alert.note: Alert for Mercer (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 4:25PM EST until January 10 at 1:45PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... Assunpink Creek At Trenton affecting Mercer County. For the Assunpink Creek...including Trenton...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Assunpink Creek at Trenton. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Assunpink Park floods. George Page Park floods. Minor street flooding in Trenton. At 9.0 feet, Mulberry Street begins to flood. At 10.0 feet, Mulberry Street flooding increases. Evacuations possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 4.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 9.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 03/14/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Assunpink Creek Trenton 8.5 4.0 Tue 3 pm 7.1 5.7 9.5 1am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 430 AM EST.
